children.subject: Like you said, if both professors are telling you it's a bad idea, it's probably a bad idea. You can try enrolling in both classes and then dropping one as the semester progresses

history.content:
I've taken both classes. You can certainly take 222 before 221A as they cover pretty different topics. The knowledge in 132 and 16B should be enough background to understand 222.

Also a starred post I had about this topic from a while ago: @11753
I've taken both classes. You can certainly take 222 before 221A as they cover pretty different topics. The knowledge in 132 and 16B should be enough background to understand 222.

children.subject: @Ashwin Vangipuram any advice on which topics/material to study to be better prepared? Thanks!

history.content:
Okay, this might be a wild idea, but how do y'all think about taking EE C222 (Nonlinear Systems) before taking ME 232 or EE 221A (Linear Systems)?

I'm a mech eng junior and just took ME 132, which is the undergraduate course on linear systems. I did very good in the course and also have taken CS 189 and the EECS 16 series. The graduate student I'm doing research with highly recommends taking nonlinear before taking graduate linear course saying "not much overlap" between those two courses. However, when I asked two professors, both discouraged me from doing so and recommended taking ME 232 before.

I know the professors are probably right, but how do y'all think? I'm just very tempted to take nonlinear first.

However, I'm also taking 3 more upper-div ME courses.

Thanks!
history.subject: Taking Nonlinear Systems (EE C222) before Linear Systems (ME 232 or EE 221a)
